description: Chevrolet 3100 Pick-up 1954 in reasonable condition

This is a 1954 Chevrolet 3100 Pick-up. The Chevy runs, stops and shifts gear. With a little bit of work the car will be roadworthy again. The car has a beautiful colour combination. The car has a 3859 CC, 6 cyl, 122 HP engine. The Chrevolet has American title, import duties are paid for.

This 1955 Chevy 3100 is for sale in our Louisville KY showroom. The 55 3100 has been an iconic staple of the classic car market place for the past couple decades and for good reason. There timeless design paired with the unlimited resources in the aftermarket gives people the opportunity to restore them back to normal or build a full custom. This 55 has had an absolute ton of work to bring it to what you see today. The all steel body has no signs of any bondo repair and appears to be free of any rust. The red paint is slick and gives the car a true hotrod feels with the scallops only putting an exclamation point on it. The bed has been done in a dark cherry stain and accented by the yellow bolts carrying the theme throughout the build. The drivetrain has been updated to a much more modern driveline. The engine is a full roller 305 that gives ample power up top and a tremendous amount of torque down low. Switched over from fuel injection to carburetion it is a much easier motor to work on. Matched up with a 4-speed manual transmission this old truck is an absolute blast to say the very least. The front end was donated by a late 70"??s Camaro and gives the car a much better feel for the road while giving it a much more aggressive stance. The interior has been tastefully with a set of bucket seats that are extremely comfortable. The shifter is in the perfect position to be slamming gears or casually shifting when taking those back road cruises. All in all this 55 is a nicely built ultra-fun truck to drive or show if that"??s your thing. Options on this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 include; AM/FM/CD Power Steering Power Brakes Cloth Interior and Alloy Wheels with Radial Tires. To view this car in full detail with HD pictures and video on this 1955Chevrolet 3100 Truck call our Louisville showroom at (812)-294-1555 or email us at
[Email Dealer]

1955 Chevrolet 3100 Series 1/2 Ton Pickup. Stepside, shortbed with wooden bed in excellent condition, black Tonneau cover, large back window. 283 Chevy V-8, 4-speed Muncie transmission, Ralley wheels, Radials, Discbrakes, Rack and Pinion Power Steering, Nice Interior, Heater works. Runs great! $21,900 OBO Call Bill for details. (209)642-0857.

A very nice truck to cruise in with a 327 V8, 5 speed Borg Warner T5  manual transmission(according to tag 85 Camaro), idependent Heidts front suspension with tubular A arms, Chevy 10 bolt rear end with air shocks, a lowered stance and a great look.  It also has the conviences you want with vintage AC, CD player and power windows.  It has a very nice engine compartment with lots of chrome. power steering and power brakes.  The power is put to the ground on 15" Chevy Ralleye rims with 5x4.5 bolt pattern, 2456015 rear, 2257015 front.  It has a great sound with dual exhaust.  This truck goes down the road great and is fun to drive. The exterior isn't your normal old truck either with louvers in the hood tailgate and rollpan.  It also has flames on the hood and front fenders.  The bed has been done in finished wood and has a rear gas tank with access thru box floor.  THe door handles have been shaved and has a frenched in power radio antenna on the passenger cab.  The interior is done with cloth bucket seats and console from a 90's silverado with gray carpet.  The gauges are newer aftermarket and the odometer shows approx 2500 miles.  I would assume that is how many miles are on the rebuild.  The truck does have a few chips that have been touched up from enjoying the truck running down the road, mainly on the running boards and top of box. The paint is of average quality good for a driver type truck.  If you are looking for a truck that will turn heads and won't break your pocket book this is the one.  Vin is located on drivers framerail.  We are upfront and honest about the condition of our cars so if you would like to have it inspected we welcome all inspectors.  We also can help you with the shipping.  Located in White,SD.  More pictures at www.bnbautosales.com

You can Buy With Confidence since we have been in the car business for 30 years.  We are a family business and will not sell you anything you don't want.  All of our vehicles are inspected and we will tell you anything that isn't working.  We have around 100 pictures and a video of our classics on our web site http://www.bnbautosales.com.  If you need anything don't hesitate to email or call as we will get any picture or another video to you.  We work and drive these cars so can personally tell you about the car.
350ci V8, Hard-to-miss Fire-Engine Red paint, Nicely Finished Interior, Like New Chrome and Trim, all ready for a new home!

The original design of the '57 Chevy Pickup is unique and very pleasing to the eye, the few small changes to the look of this truck add just a little more appeal to an already appreciated design.  The '57's were the only year that have the larger grille opening - in '58 the design of the Chevy pickups was dramatically different.
The exterior of this truck is in very good condition.  New bumpers, new grille, new trim/seals,  and a recent paint job all help to make this an eye catching truck.

Thanks to the style-side bed and rear fender treatment this truck is extra curvy.  The glossy bright Red paint that covers all this trucks curves pairs well with the reupholstered Black interior.  The interior is in great condition and features new carpet, new headliner, a reupholstered bench seat, auxiliary gauges, seatbelts, a classic looking new radio that has MP3/iPod connectivity, and new speakers.
The bed of the truck is finished with aged wood and retains the original-style tail gate.

Lift the curvy hood and you will find a 350ci Chevrolet V8 that breathes through a Edelbrock 4BBL Carb and Holley intake manifold.  The transmission is a TH350 3-speed automatic.  The engine install is very neat and surely provides plenty of power for this classic truck.  This truck had power steering added, and retains the original mechanical drum brake setup.
This is a seriously cool truck that is ready to take you around town or to the local cruise night!

1950 Chevrolet 3100 5 Window Pickup

You are looking at a complete frame off restoration that was nicely done. The previous owner has owned this beauty for several years. He was very meticulous on his restoration. The truck has a 235ci straight six, with a 4 speed transmission.

The light yellow paint looks like it was just done. The restoration is only a couple of years since restored. All the chrome and stainless are like new, including front grill, headlight bezels, front and rear bumpers and dual mirrors.
The wood bed with chrome slots, running boards and wide white wall tires are all new, including Chevy hub caps.
These 5 window trucks are getting harder to find in this condition.
If you are interested in this vehicle or have any questions,
please call Juan at 503-653-4030

title: 1956 Chevrolet 3100 Step Side Short Box 1/2 Ton

Starts every time,
4-speed transmission,

Dealer undercoated,

All new window glass,
New window seals and electrical wiring,
Firestone white wall tires,
Drives and runs great,
Must see to believe and appreciate.
Call to arrange a test drive or to receive more pictures or information.

1952 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup. VIN 5KPF13044. Odometer reads 4,528 miles. Upgraded to 292ci inline 6 cylinder engine with HEI electronic ignition, split exhaust manifold and 12 volt alternator. Original 3 speed manual transmission and rear differential. Manual steering / manual brakes. Converted to electric windshield wipers. This truck starts right up every time and runs great. It cruises down the highway nicely. The brakes work great and steering is very good. The body is very solid and straight. Has nice paint - looks great! The interior is in excellent condition and shows well. Overall, a real nice vintage Chevrolet truck that`s dependable and looks fantastic.

For sale at Gateway Classic Cars of Philadelphia is this sharp 1955 Chevrolet 3100 that really turns heads both young and old!  This fine truck derives its lineage to the Chevrolet Task Force Series that ran from 1955 to 1959. Many of the iconic Chevy pickups of that era have become synonymous with post-war America and the rejuvenated spirit of enterprise and adventure!  Relive those days with this beauty as she is ready to go!  An attractive black paint job makes this truck stand out amongst the others coupled with a set of sporty Ridler ® custom wheels that tie the whole vehicle together!  Pop open the hood and you"??ll find a 350 CID V8 engine ready to take you where you need to be!  Make your way to the inside and you"??ll be sure to love the black interior with comfortable seats and a Hurst ® shifter linked to a Muncie four-speed manual transmission! What"??s stopping you from reliving the good ol"?? days or even better making new memories in this nostalgic ride?  Just imagine putting the tailgate down and lying down on the solid wooden truck bed looking up at some stars or driving to meet some friends at a car cruise.  Don"??t let this opportunity to own this piece of Americana slip away! Additional features include 10-bolt Posi rear 3:73 gears and heat. To view this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our Philadelphia showroom located in West Deptford NJ. For more information please call 856-599-4100 or email
[Email Dealer]
1953 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup
Excellent Condition In/Out/Under
235ci Straight-6 & 4spd Manual
H: 3100 Series
J: Janesville, Wisconsin Assembly Plant
Engine Serial : FII29J
Block : J317 3738807. Flint, MI. October 31st, 1957.
CONSIGNMENT SALE

We're selling this beautiful ‘53 Chevy 3100 pickup on behalf of a local gentleman who has owned the truck for more than twenty years. The truck has been maintained by a mechanic who we know very well. In the last four years, the car has seen a carburetor rebuild, new tires, and new wheel cylinders. As it sits, this is a very nice, well-sorted, fun-to-drive truck that is in need of nothing other than a new owner. Please take a look through the photos and accompanying video, as the truck is shown in much detail.
Exterior:

- See video with listing, as every blemish on the car is shown close-up. The most major blemish is a concentration of light scratches on the driver's rear quarter. Overall, paint shows very well. No dust under the paint or anything of the sort, paint was clearly done to a high standard.
- All wood is in excellent shape. No damage and shines bright.
- Wheels are in nice shape, just showing some minor age around the outer ring. Toyo Extensa tires are in excellent shape, and the DOT number indicates that they were manufactured in 2009.
- Sills are in great shape, with just some minor chipping.
- Glass and light lenses are all clear and crack-free
Interior:
- Black leather bench seat is in nice shape. There is a fraying seam on the driver's seat bottom, as well as a couple little nicks, but overall very good condition.
- Odometer indicates 53,459 miles. We cannot be certain that the odometer indicates actual mileage, as it's a 5-digit.
- Truck has lap and shoulder belts
- Rubber floormat is in nice shape
- Body-colored dash is in great shape. No scratching or damage.
- Dash chrome is excellent
Under the Hood / Underbody:
- The engine is a Thriftmaster 235ci Straight-6, date stamped October 1957.

- Truck runs and drives extremely well. Starts right up, idles steady and very quietly, shifts smoothly, and accelerates without any hesitation. The truck tracks dead straight under both acceleration and braking, and the brakes are excellent. Wouldn't hesitate to drive the truck anywhere; it's well-sorted.

- Please take a look through the underbody photos, as it's documented in detail. Underbody is one of the highlights of the car, it looks great. Absolutely no through rust, and barely even any surface rust. No damage or anything of the sort, and no evidence of any leaks.

Overall, this is a well presented, ready-to-enjoy ‘53 pickup that is sure to make the next owner very happy. With any further questions, requests, or to discuss purchasing, please reach out to Jake at 773-267-2684.

This 1951 Chevrolet 3100 is a full custom mix of vintage and new worlds wrapped in an intimidating matte black.  So as you look at all the details, you'll soon realize the truck you've always wanted to build is already here, and it's ready to roll today.

The first impression is a sinister all-black machine.  But if you look at it for more than a moment, you begin to see a lot of thoughtful details.  For example, the traditionally chrome grille keeps its flair by bring finished in gloss black.  And speaking of flair, if you've seen any of the rear photos, you instantly recognize the bed of a late-model Chevy Silverado flareside.  It's expertly integrated and painted the same matte black to make this upgrade look like it has been there since day one.   Plus, you have a nice tonneau cover to keep the elements away for the green carpeting inside.

And the green in the bed is also a preview of the interior.  While this one looks mean on the outside, it's quite relaxing on the inside with a green and beige tweed setup.  Custom comfort starts with dual bucket seats (the driver's one individually power adjusts to your perfect position.)  In-between is an armrest center console that also has an AM/FM/CD stereo, cup holders, and controls for the modern R134a air conditioning.  You'll slip behind the Grant GT wood-rimmed steering wheel.  And beyond that is an updated VDO speedometer to reflect the extra speed this one has over anything from 1951.

The engine bay has the unmistakable look of power with the 350 cubic-inch V8.  This small block has been upgraded further with Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor, Holley Street Dominator intake, and a rumbling glasspack-style dual exhaust.  And to keep it all running smooth (even with the A/C pumping) there's a Champion aluminum radiator.  All of this goes to the heart of this build – a mean looking truck with plenty of thoughtful comfort.  That's also why you have features like independent front suspension w/sway bar, power steering, and front disc brakes.
This is an impressive total build, but the most remarkable part is that it can all be had for such an affordable price.  Don't miss this one.  Call today!!!

Chevrolet 3100 Pick-up 1955 This Chevrolet 3100 pick-up comes from the year 1955. The Chevy drives, brakes and shifts.  Beautiful colour combination. This Chevrolet 3100 needs but a little work to be roadworthy again. The engine is a 6-cylinder 3859cc with 122hp.  The Chevrolet comes with an American title, the import duties have been paid. This vehicle can be viewed and picked up in Waalwijk, the Netherlands

The truck you've always wanted to build is ready to hit the road or trail today.  This 1955 Chevrolet takes the classic 3100 body and mounts it on a more modern 4x4 frame, and it even has great upgrades like V8 power and an A/C interior.

This truck knows how to instantly announce it's something different.  The modern application of a blue-green paint has a eye-catching level of gloss.  In fact, the only thing to outshine it are all the brightwork pieces you expect from a first-year Task Force truck.  This includes the chrome bumpers, wide grille, headlight surrounds, and side mirrors.  But while this kind of presentation can be found on street-eating custom Chevy trucks, this one stands above those... literally.  It's tough 4x4 prowess is gives it the kind of lifted stance that not many people see on these classics.  But more than just look ready to get down to business, this custom truck is also properly equipped.  That's why you have nice side steps to easily get into the cab.  Plus, there's a trailer hitch so you can be the coolest pickup to arrive with everything from a boat to a camper.

Inside, you can see the new and vintage worlds blending seamlessly.  The vinyl on the bench seat nicely coordinates with the exterior color.  Plus, it has been customized with a Chevy bow tie embroidered in the center as well as comfortable cloth inserts for where you sit.  As you grab the newer Chevy steering wheel, it gives you a great view of classic 3100 elements that are still on display, like the gauges and dash panel.  But your real favorite feature is much more modern.  After all, we all love staying cool with R134a air conditioning.

When you look under the hood, this really begins to reveal the true nature of this beast. The 350 cubic-inch V8 topped with a four-barrel carburetor is far more powerful than the stock 3100 motor.  And its fresh presentation lets you know it was cared for correctly.  That extra power from this V8 will be appreciated, because you can really use this truck for work and play.  This versatility starts with the chassis of a younger K-series 4x4. The four-wheel drive engages smoothly, and so you know this build was done right.  And since it comes from one of Chevy's longest production runs, the stout 4x4 components will always be easy to source. This more modern setup also means nice conveniences like power steering, a three-speed automatic transmission, BF Goodrich All-Terrain T/As, and front disc brakes.
Rarely do you find a total package that's vintage, aggressive, and so capable.  So you know you need to hurry to grab turn-key ready head-turner. Call today!!!
